intro: Anechites, commonly known as yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically succulent and arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps it conserve water. Anechites thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
